intro: Bicornella perrieri, commonly known as the Perrier's bicorn, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of Madagascar. It is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves, which give it its scientific name. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, commonly known as the daisy or sunflower family. Bicornella perrieri typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
